topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Download the Installation Packages

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Installation Prerequisites

body.p: This document describes the prerequisite steps required to install HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.

section.title: Download and unpack the installation packages
section.p: Before you begin, you must download the required HP Helion OpenStack installation package(s). For the 10/16 POC release, the installation packages are located using FTP at HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade V2.0. HPE internal network access is required.http://16.78.71.141/uploads/hcg-2-0-beta/hcg-2-0-beta.tar

The FTP download, hcg-2-0-beta.tar, contains all of the files you will need to install and configure HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. This is a large file that might take a significant amount of time to download, depending upon the speed of your network.
Note: For deployments using ESX and DCN, you will need to obtain the and install the VMware ESX and HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) software through those entities.

section.title: Obtain the required Debian packages
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade maintains a local Debian repository on the KVM Host from where Debain packages are installed. Download these files from a trusted source and copy them to the /root/cg/dcn directory.

section.title: Download the ESX packages
section.p: To integrate VMware ESX storage, download all required ESX packages needed to deploy the ESX environment, including the VMware vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) . The hcg-2-0-beta.tar file contains the template file required for the ESX Compute Proxy.

section.title: Verify the downloaded checksums
section.p: You should also use a checksum verification tool, such as sha256sum, which should come installed with Ubuntu.
